title.narrative: Inclusive futures in Rwanda: establishing and applying a set of national standards and norms in inclusive education

description.narrative: The innovation will increase access to quality education, participation and retention of CWDs and other SEN in Rwanda. It will do this through: the development of norms and standards on inclusive education & special needs education; strengthening the capacity of the Rwanda Education Board (REB), the Task Force for the Development of Inclusive Education in Rwanda (TFDIER), local authorities, special centres and other local and community stakeholders to apply, monitor and enforce these standards; and so improving learning outcomes. ;

This project will focus on increasing the capacity of national institutions (Rwanda Education Board (REB), Kigali Institute of Education (KIE) and the Task Force for the Development of Inclusive Education in Rwanda (TFDIER)) in the development of a model (norms, standards and tools) to reinforce the quality of education for CWDs and other SENs.;

description.narrative:
Southern Province is one of Rwanda's five provinces. It was created in early January 2006 as part of a government decentralization programme that re-organized the country's local government structures.
Southern Province is divided into the districts of Butare, Gatagara, Gikongoro, Gisagara, Gitarama, Kamonyi, Nyanza, and Nyaruguru. The capital city is Nyanza

activity-description.narrative: The project promotes the inclusive education of children with disabilities and other Special Educational Needs (SEN) through the testing and application at district level of norms and standards relating to access to and use of appropriate learning technology, educational skills, and monitoring and evaluation systems that promote accountability to beneficiaries.
